headline: Security Specialist at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE)
summary:
Managed and directly supervised 280 employees
Supervised and developed the command security program for over 4,500 personnel
Accountable for over $25 million in various aviation maintenance and facility equipment.  
Supervised over 5,200 man-hours in aviation maintenance work orders. Coordinated four separate 40-hour training courses.   Planned and coordinated a corporate move into a newly constructed seven building complex.  Developed and maintained the personnel security clearance rosters, training, and requests for national agency checks. Managed over 100 fielding events of various new military equipment at the General Officer level.  Reviewed budget estimates for training requirements generated by employees.  Established a budget estimate document for travel and pay; document adopted by higher levels and used throughout the organization. Supervised the planning and implementation of the anti-terrorism and physical security programs.  Established all policies, procedures, training, and inspections at the general command level in accordance with all regulations and policies in the area of security management.  Inspected the procedures and policies of three lower departments in security procedures.  Analyzed and briefed leadership on security issues; recommending changes to security practices.  Solely established department policies and procedures.  Maintained 100% accountability of all classified medium without compromise. Managed JPAS accounts; directly coordinated with investigative agencies on personnel security issues. Authorized proper use of US Army aviation equipment as a Government Flight Representative.  Managed program resources in excess of $610,000 across 11 separate funding codes.  Maintained company resource funding for training within expected budget of $650,000. Only Defense Travel System (DTS) approving official for over six months at the command level; authorizing funding for travel expenses for over 180 employees.

defaultPosition.description: Observe, coach, mentor, train clients on current operational Army doctrine while the client performs knowledge management and staff functions under controlled environments.  Established training requirement to prepare for client exercises in all types of environments.
defaultPosition.title: Observer, Controller/ Trainer (OC/T)

positions.description: Observe, coach, mentor, train clients on current operational Army doctrine while the client performs knowledge management and staff functions under controlled environments.  Established training requirement to prepare for client exercises in all types of environments.
positions.title: Observer, Controller/ Trainer (OC/T)

positions.description: Suitability and Security adjudicator for employment; periodic reinvestigations; and clearance eligibility.  Evaluate potential and current employees on all suitability and security guidelines IAW Executive Orders, OPM, and DHS directives.
positions.title: Security Specialist

positions.description: Quality and process improvement engineer for standby electronic power generation.  Developed system analysis, process management and improvements across the manufacturing of lead-calcium batteries.  Assessed and implemented plant wide and corporate wide quality audits with solutions to issues discovered.  Briefed leadership on findings and recommended solutions.
positions.title: Quality Engineer

positions.description: Commanded, led, mentored, trained, and administered over 280 Soldiers assigned to the only aviation intermediate maintenance unit in the Army Reserve.  Maintained over $25 million in equipment and facilities.
positions.location: Naval Air Station Fort Worth, TX
positions.title: Company Commander

positions.description: Established and coordinated equipment modernization requirements from HQ Department of the Army through the Army Reserve Command to 23 separate units across 17 different states.  Additionally analyzed manpower requirements, new unit stationing packets, and TDA/MTOE allocations.
positions.title: Force Programs Force Modernization Officer

positions.description: Deputy Chief of Staff, Intelligence; appointed Command Security Manager, Anti-terrorism Level II trained.  Established, trained, and implemented the security programs in PERSEC (personnel), INFOSEC (information), COMSEC (communications), Physical Security, Anti-terrorism, and industry.  Completed staff assistance visits and inspections.  Analyzed trends and briefed commander in potential risks and risk mitigation.
positions.title: G2; Command Security Manager

positions.companyName: Brad Haynes Tae Kwon Do Academy
positions.description: Certified instructor and school manager assisting school owner in the day to day activities of the school.  Assisted in rank testing and ceremonies.  Developed class training plans, mentored students in training and goal setting.
positions.title: Certified Instructor
